raw: Traders play 'hot potato' with U.S. oil contract as it crashes 50% .

raw: By David Gaffen ( Reuters ) - Energy traders bailed out of the expiring May U.S. oil futures contract in a frenzy on Monday , as the contract dropped by more than 50 % to less than $ 8 a barrel and opening the widest gap ever between it and the next contract with storage rapidly filling .
replaced: By David Gregorio ( Reuters ) - Energy traders bailed out of the June contract in a frenzy on Monday , as the June contract dropped by more than 50 % to less than $ 8 a barrel and opening That yawning gap  the June contract and the next contract with storage rapidly filling .

raw: That yawning gap has opened because a glut of oil is heading towards the United States while demand has dropped by 30 % due to the coronavirus pandemic .
replaced: That yawning gap has opened because a glut of oil is heading towards the United States while demand has dropped by 30 % due to the coronavirus pandemic .

raw: While oil - producing nations have agreed to cut output and major global oil companies are also trimming production , those cuts will not come quickly enough to avoid a massive clog in the next couple of weeks .
